metadata.title: CVE-2014-6393 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: The Express web framework before 3.11 and 4.x before 4.5 for Node.js doesnot provide a charset field in HTTP Content-Type headers in 400 levelresponses, which might allow remote attackers to conduct cross-sitescripting (XSS) attacks via characters in a non-standard encoding.

criterions.comment: node-express: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
